Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Freak \Freak\ (fr[=e]k), v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Freaked} (fr[=e]kt); p. pr. & vb. n. {Freaking}.] [Akin to OE. frakin, freken, freckle, Icel. freknur, pl., Sw. fr["a]kne, Dan. fregne, Gr. perkno`s dark-colored, Skr. p[.r][,c]ni variegated. Cf. {Freckle}, {Freck}.] To variegate; to checker; to streak. [R.] [1913 Webster]
Freaked with many a mingled hue. --Thomson. [1913 Webster]
